CatDescriptText: Mrs. Julia Vassar, housewife, of 157 Flavel Street was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 28, 1959, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that education standards should be the same throughout the city school system or should they be lowered in order to accommodate the slower-learning pupils, particularly those who suffer the handicaps of poor home or neighborhood environments?" answer reads: "I'm definitely in favor of educating both the fast learners and the slow learners. As for the slow learners, I think that they should be put into a special class.  The school standards should be the same and not lowered for the rest of the pupils."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Julia Vassar wearing flecked coat with four spiral buttons, and dark hat, standing on sidewalk in front of store with sign reading "...Work...Shoes...Sale..."
